('22', 295, 4, 12, 726910) 151. NOTES
('22', 295, 5, 13, 726921) SWARAJ SABHA
('22', 295, 6, 14, 726934) Apropos of reorganization, the question has been asked as to what is to become of Swaraj Sabhas, Home Rule Leagues, etc.
('22', 295, 6, 15, 727055) In my opinion their institutional activity, for the time being, should be swaraj activity.
('22', 295, 7, 16, 727146) PATIENCE WANTED
('22', 295, 8, 17, 727162) The construction of an organization such as I have adumbrated means patience.
('22', 295, 8, 18, 727240) In their zeal, I understand, certain workers in Bihar, with a view to bring about a reduction of prices, began to intimidate shopkeepers and are said to have used my name for that purpose.
('22', 295, 8, 19, 727429) Such exhibition of force will defeat the end we have in view.
('22', 295, 8, 20, 727491) If shopkeepers are not dealing honestly we must reason with them, and if they will not listen, we must set up national shops for the purpose of supplying cheap grain.
('22', 295, 8, 21, 727658) As a matter of fact the grain traders?
('22', 295, 8, 22, 727697) being so many, are ill able to charge exorbitant prices.
('22', 295, 8, 23, 727754) In any case, the grain dealers, too, have got to be purified.
('22', 295, 8, 24, 727816) They must be induced to introduce honesty and concern for the nation into their dealings.
('22', 296, 0, 1, 727906) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 297
('22', 296, 1, 2, 727952) AWAKENING IN BIHAR
('22', 296, 2, 3, 727971) But these excesses will sometimes happen when a great revival is taking place.
('22', 296, 2, 4, 728050) Fortunately, the leaders were able immediately to deal with the situation, and, probably, nobody even knows anything about the incident except those immediately concerned.
('22', 296, 2, 5, 728222) Bihar is silently, but surely, organizing itself.
('22', 296, 2, 6, 728272) Babu Rajendra Prasad has become the Principal of a National College 1 which has some able professors on its staff, and their institution is making steady headway.
('22', 296, 2, 7, 728435) The professors are mostly volunteers drawing just enough for a livelihood.
('22', 296, 3, 8, 728510) SITTING “DHARNA”
('22', 296, 4, 9, 728527) Some students of Calcutta have revived the ancient form of barbarity in the form of sitting dharna 2. Fortunately, the practice was stopped as soon as it was revived.
('22', 296, 4, 10, 728694) They blocked the passage of their fellow students who wanted to go to the University for paying their fees or to see some officials of the educational department.
('22', 296, 4, 11, 728857) I call it ‘barbarity’ for it is a crude way of using coercion.
('22', 296, 4, 12, 728920) It is also cowardly because one who sits dharna knows that he is not going to be trampled over.
('22', 296, 4, 13, 729016) It is difficult to call the practice violent but it is certainly worse.
('22', 296, 4, 14, 729088) If we fight our opponent we at least enable him to return the blow.
('22', 296, 4, 15, 729156) But when we challenge him to walk over us, knowing that he will not, we place him in a most awkward and humiliating position.
('22', 296, 4, 16, 729282) I know that the overzealous students who sat dharna never thought of the barbarity of the deed.
('22', 296, 4, 17, 729378) But one who is expected to follow the voice of conscience and stand even single handed in the face of odds cannot afford to be thoughtless.
('22', 296, 4, 18, 729518) Non co operation, if it fails, will fail only through internal weakness.
('22', 296, 4, 19, 729591) There is no such thing as defeat in non co operation.
('22', 296, 4, 20, 729645) It never fails.
('22', 296, 4, 21, 729661) Its so called representatives may so badly represent their cause that it may appear to the spectators to have failed.
('22', 296, 4, 22, 729779) Let non co operationists therefore beware of everything they do.
('22', 296, 4, 23, 729844) There must be no impatience, no barbarity, no insolence, no undue pressure.
('22', 296, 4, 24, 729920) If we want to cultivate a true spirit of democracy, we cannot afford to be intolerant.
('22', 296, 4, 25, 730007) Intolerance betrays want of faith in one’s cause.
('22', 296, 5, 26, 730057) 1 At Patna, in Bihar 2 Exerting moral pressure by sitting at one spot and going without food or water
('22', 297, 0, 1, 730159) 298 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 297, 1, 2, 730201) THE NEED FOR HINDUSTANI
('22', 297, 2, 3, 730225) I have ventured to advise every student to devote this year of our trial to the manufacture of yarn and learning Hindustani.
('22', 297, 2, 4, 730350) I am thankful to the Calcutta students that they have taken kindly to the suggestion.
('22', 297, 2, 5, 730436) Bengal and Madras are the two provinces that are cut off from the rest of India for want of a knowledge of Hindustani on their part—Bengal, because of its prejudice against learning any other language of India, and Madras, because of the difficulty of the Dravidians about picking up Hindustani.
('22', 297, 2, 6, 730732) An average Bengali can really learn Hindustani in two months if he gave it three hours per day and a Dravidian in six months at the same rate.
('22', 297, 2, 7, 730875) Neither a Bengali nor a Dravidian can hope to achieve the same result with English in the same time.
('22', 297, 2, 8, 730976) A knowledge of English opens up intercourse only with the comparatively few English knowing Indians, whereas a passable knowledge of Hindustani enables us to hold intercourse with the largest number of our countrymen.
('22', 297, 2, 9, 731194) I do hope the Bengalis and the Dravidians will come to the next Congress 1 with a workable knowledge of Hindustani.
('22', 297, 2, 10, 731310) Our greatest assembly cannot be a real object lesson to the masses unless it speaks to them in a language which the the largest number can understand.
('22', 297, 2, 11, 731461) I appreciate the difficulty with the Dravidians, but nothing is difficult before their industrious love for the Motherland.
('22', 297, 3, 12, 731585) THE PLACE OF ENGLISH
('22', 297, 4, 13, 731606) Alongside of my suggestion about Hindustani has been the advice that the students should, during the transition period from inferiority to equality—from foreign domination to swaraj, from helplessness to self help—suspend their study of English.
('22', 297, 4, 14, 731852) If we wish to attain swaraj before the next Congress, we must believe in the possibility, we must do all that we are capable of doing for its advancement, and one must do nothing that would not advance it or would actually retard it.
('22', 297, 4, 15, 732086) Now adding to our knowledge of English cannot accelerate our progress towards our goal and it can conceivably retard it.
('22', 297, 4, 16, 732207) The latter calamity is a reality in many cases for there are many who believe that we cannot acquire the spirit of freedom without the music of the English words ringing in our ears and sounding through our lips.
('22', 297, 4, 17, 732420) This is an infatuation.
('22', 297, 4, 18, 732444) If it were the truth, swaraj would be as distant as the Greek Kalends.
('22', 297, 4, 19, 732515) English is a
('22', 297, 5, 20, 732528) 1 To be held at Ahmedabad in December 1921
('22', 298, 0, 1, 732571) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 299
('22', 298, 1, 2, 732617) language of international commerce, it is the language of diplomacy, it contains many a rich literary treasure, and it gives us an introduction to Western thought and culture.
('22', 298, 1, 3, 732793) For a few of us, therefore, a knowledge of English is necessary.
('22', 298, 1, 4, 732858) They can carry on the departments of national commerce and international diplomacy, and for giving to the nation the best of Western literature, thought, and science.
('22', 298, 1, 5, 733025) That would be the legitimate use of English.
('22', 298, 1, 6, 733070) Whereas today English has usurped the dearest place in our hearts and dethroned our mother tongues.
('22', 298, 1, 7, 733170) It is an unnatural place due to our unequal relations with Englishmen.
('22', 298, 1, 8, 733241) The highest development of the Indian mind must be possible without a knowledge of English.
('22', 298, 1, 9, 733333) It is doing violence to the manhood and specially the womanhood of India to encourage our boys and girls to think that an entry into the best society is impossible without a knowledge of English.
('22', 298, 1, 10, 733529) It is too humiliating a thought to be bearable.
('22', 298, 1, 11, 733577) To get rid of the infatuation for English is one of the essentials of swaraj.
('22', 298, 2, 12, 733655) MY ‘STABLE COMPANION’
('22', 298, 3, 13, 733677) Commander Wedgwood has not done justice to himself in his article in the Nation.
('22', 298, 3, 14, 733758) I am afraid that he wrote without a proper study of facts and persons.
('22', 298, 3, 15, 733829) I do not wish to deal with inaccuracies concerning myself.
('22', 298, 3, 16, 733888) But his ignorance of Maulana Shaukat Ali is amazing.
('22', 298, 3, 17, 733941) He does not understand the secret of the power of Maulana Shaukat Ali who is one of the sincerest of men I have had the privilege of meeting.
('22', 298, 3, 18, 734083) I do not believe that he hates Englishmen —or anybody for that matter.
('22', 298, 3, 19, 734154) He certainly loves his religion as life itself.
('22', 298, 3, 20, 734202) He does believe in non violence, though he believes equally in violence.
('22', 298, 3, 21, 734275) If he cannot secure honourable terms for the Khilafat by means of non violence, and if he finds that he can usefully lead his people on the path of violence, he will do so.
('22', 298, 3, 22, 734448) If ever he thinks it necessary to offer violence he will do it on terms that the world will consider beyond reproach.
('22', 298, 3, 23, 734566) His conviction about non violence is not only not “skin deep” but is derived from the life of the Prophet.
('22', 298, 3, 24, 734673) He is enjoined to refrain from violence so long as it is possible to attain his purpose by non violent means.
('22', 298, 3, 25, 734783) Wedgwood’s article would almost show that Maulana Shaukat Ali is simply thirsting for blood.
('22', 298, 3, 26, 734876) Surely he should know that a soldier, although he believes in violence, may still be credited with qualities of the heart, viz., kindness, charity, and benevolence.
('22', 298, 3, 27, 735041) I assure him that Maulana Shaukat Ali is as good a soldier as the gallant Colonel himself.
('22', 298, 3, 28, 735132) I have entered upon this reply
('22', 299, 0, 1, 735163) 300 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 299, 1, 2, 735205) because I am anxious that Englishmen should not misjudge the Ali Brothers and the Muslim attitude.
('22', 299, 1, 3, 735304) The Ali Brothers have rendered a service to humanity by restraining themselves and their fellow religionists when their passions might have got the better of them.
('22', 299, 1, 4, 735468) And this amazing self restraint is a most eloquent demonstration of their intense religious faith.
('22', 299, 1, 5, 735567) It saddens me when I find Englishmen, even like Col.
('22', 299, 1, 6, 735620) Wedgwood, rushing to conclusions.
('22', 299, 1, 7, 735654) Nothing retards a peaceful settlement as this refusal on the part of Englishmen to see things as they are.
('22', 299, 2, 8, 735761) Young India, 2 2 1921
('22', 299, 3, 9, 735783) 152. THE DUTY OF SPINNING
('22', 299, 4, 10, 735809) In “The Secret of Swaraj” I have endeavoured to show what home spinning means for our country.
('22', 299, 4, 11, 735904) 1 In any curriculum of the future, spinning must be a compulsory subject.
('22', 299, 4, 12, 735978) Just as we cannot live without breathing and without eating, so is it impossible for us to attain economic independence and banish pauperism from this ancient land without reviving home spinning.
('22', 299, 4, 13, 736174) I hold the spinning wheel to be as much a necessity in every household as the hearth.
('22', 299, 4, 14, 736260) No other scheme that can be devised will ever solve the problem of the deepening poverty of the people.
('22', 299, 4, 15, 736364) How then can spinning be introduced in every home?
('22', 299, 4, 16, 736415) I have already suggested the introduction of spinning and systematic production of yarn in every national school.
('22', 299, 4, 17, 736529) Once our boys and girls have learnt the art they can easily carry it to their homes.
('22', 299, 4, 18, 736614) But this requires organization.
('22', 299, 4, 19, 736646) A spinning wheel must be worked for twelve hours per day.
('22', 299, 4, 20, 736704) A practised spinner can spin two tolas and a half per hour.
('22', 299, 4, 21, 736764) The price that is being paid at present is on an average four annas per forty tolas or one pound of yarn, i.e., one pice per hour.
('22', 299, 4, 22, 736895) Each wheel therefore should give three annas per day.
('22', 299, 4, 23, 736949) A strong one costs seven rupees.
('22', 299, 4, 24, 736982) Working, therefore, at the rate of twelve hours per day it can pay for itself in less than 38 days.
('22', 299, 4, 25, 737082) I have given enough figures to work upon.
('22', 299, 4, 26, 737124) Anyone working at them will find the results to be startling.
('22', 299, 4, 27, 737186) If every school introduced spinning, it would revolutionize our ideas of financing education.
('22', 299, 4, 28, 737280) We can work a school for six hours per
('22', 299, 5, 29, 737319) 1 Vide “The Secret of Swaraj”, 19 1 1921.
('22', 300, 0, 1, 737361) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 301
('22', 300, 1, 2, 737407) day and give free education to the pupils.
('22', 300, 1, 3, 737450) Supposing a boy works at the wheel for four hours daily, he will produce every day 10 tolas of yarn and thus earn for his school one Anna per day.
('22', 300, 1, 4, 737597) Suppose further that he manufactures very little during the first month, and that the school works only twenty six days in the month.
('22', 300, 1, 5, 737731) He can earn after the first month Rs. 1 10 0 per month.
('22', 300, 1, 6, 737787) A class of thirty boys would yield, after the first month, an income of Rs. 48 12 per month.
('22', 300, 1, 7, 737880) I have said nothing about literary training.
('22', 300, 1, 8, 737925) It can be given during the two hours out of the six.
('22', 300, 1, 9, 737978) It is easy to see that every school can be made self supporting without much effort and the nation can engage experienced teachers for its schools.
('22', 300, 1, 10, 738126) The chief difficulty in working out the scheme is the spinning wheel.
('22', 300, 1, 11, 738196) We require thousands of wheels if the art becomes popular.
('22', 300, 1, 12, 738255) Fortunately, every village carpenter can easily construct the machine.
('22', 300, 1, 13, 738326) It is a serious mistake to order them from the Ashram or any other place.
('22', 300, 1, 14, 738400) The beauty of spinning is that it is incredibly simple, easily learnt, and can be cheaply introduced in every village.
('22', 300, 1, 15, 738519) The course suggested by me is intended only for this year of purification and probation.
('22', 300, 1, 16, 738608) When normal times are reached and swaraj is established one hour only may be given to spinning and the rest to literary training.
('22', 300, 2, 17, 738738) Young India, 2 2 1921
('22', 300, 3, 18, 738760) 153. REORGANIZATION OF PROVINCES: THE NEW CONSTITUTION
('22', 300, 4, 19, 738815) It is to be hoped that the different provinces have begun to reorganize themselves in terms of the new constitution 1. There is not a moment to lose if we are to attain swaraj within one year.
('22', 300, 4, 20, 739008) Below will be found the rules 2 adopted by Gujarat for reorganizing the province on the new basis.
('22', 300, 4, 21, 739107) They are published for general guidance.
('22', 300, 4, 22, 739148) They show that it is convenient to treat talukas as units for returning delegates and electing members of the Provincial Congress Committee.
('22', 300, 4, 23, 739289) That Committee is to consist of 100 members of whom 90 will be directly elected and these will elect ten more so as to ensure representation of minorities and other interests—if the general body
('22', 300, 5, 24, 739484) 1 Vide “Congress constitution adopted at Nagpur session”, december 1920. 2 Not reproduced here.

('22', 301, 1, 2, 739622) of electors have omitted to do so.
('22', 301, 1, 3, 739657) There should not be a single village left without a Congress organization and no village register should be without a single adult male or female on it 1. This means honest and industrious workers.
('22', 301, 1, 4, 739855) When millions have voluntarily joined the Congress, the forced organization of the Government must fall to pieces.
('22', 301, 1, 5, 739970) I consider the Government organization to be forced because it is based on fear and not on hope.
('22', 301, 1, 6, 740067) The Patel or the Mukhi 2 not a man executing the will of the villagers but he imposes on them the will of a Government which has nothing in common with the people.
('22', 301, 2, 7, 740231) Young India, 2 2 1921
('22', 301, 3, 8, 740253) 154. LETTER TO A FRIEND 3
('22', 301, 4, 9, 740279) 148, RUSSA ROAD, CALCUTTA, February 2, 1921
('22', 301, 5, 10, 740323) DEAR FRIEND, I have heard that you have gone on hunger strike at not findingsufficient response from your neighbours to the call of non co operation.
('22', 301, 5, 11, 740473) Whilst your action shows the purity of your heart and the spirit of sacrifice, in my opinion, it is hasty and possibly thoughtless.
('22', 301, 5, 12, 740605) Fasting for the purpose of showing one’s displeasure or disappointment can hardly be justified.
('22', 301, 5, 13, 740701) Its basis must be penance or purification.
('22', 301, 5, 14, 740744) I would therefore strongly advise you to stop fasting and devote yourself to organizing those parts of the country where you are known.
('22', 301, 5, 15, 740880) We must not put pressure of the kind contemplated by your fast in order to bring people round to our point of view.
('22', 301, 5, 16, 740996) We must give to everyone the same freedom of action and speech that we claim for ourselves.
('22', 301, 6, 17, 741088) Yours sincerely, M. K. GANDHI
('22', 301, 7, 18, 741118) From the manuscript of Mahadev Desai’s Diary.

('22', 302, 1, 2, 741327) 155. LETTER TO ROY
('22', 302, 2, 3, 741346) 148 RUSSA ROAD, CALCUTTA, [Before February 4, 1921] 1
('22', 302, 3, 4, 741400) DEAR MR. ROY, I have been in correspondence for some time with your daughter as I have been with many other girls and boys.
('22', 302, 3, 5, 741524) I have had the pleasure too of meeting your daughter and her companions more than once.
('22', 302, 3, 6, 741612) As Kumari Lalita has often referred to your attitude about her desire to withdraw from her college, I would like you [to] know my advice to your daughter.
('22', 302, 3, 7, 741767) In my opinion no self respecting boy or girl can possibly receive education in institutions in any way controlled or dominated by a Government so wicked as ours.
('22', 302, 3, 8, 741929) If I were a student, and had to chosse between education under the influence of such a Government and no education, I would not hesitate to choose the latter.
('22', 302, 3, 9, 742088) Whilst I have pressed this argument upon your daughter as on every other student, I have advised her to be largely guided by your advice and if it were a matter of choosing between your advice and mine, certainly to prefer yours to mine.
('22', 302, 3, 10, 742326) But I have also added that if she is really convinced about the wickedness of the Government and therefore the necessity of withdrawing from her college, she could not fail to secure you consent and blessing in following the voice of her conscience.
('22', 302, 3, 11, 742576) I write this to you as I am most anxious, being a parent myself, to respect to the utmost extent the susceptibilities of parents especially in the case of girls.
('22', 302, 3, 12, 742738) You will perhaps permit me to say that I feel for your daughter as I would for my own.
('22', 302, 3, 13, 742825) It has been a pleasure to me to read in all her letters a scrupulous regard for her parents.
('22', 302, 3, 14, 742918) And I need hardly assure you that I would not be guilty of undermining the duty of children towards their parents.
('22', 302, 3, 15, 743033) Your daughter has, I may inform you, given me her valuable bangles for the Swaraj Fund.
('22', 302, 3, 16, 743121) 2 I would like to have a line of your approval of her gift.
('22', 302, 3, 17, 743181) As I have come in close contact with your daughter I would like to make your acquaintane and understand your wishes in the matter.
('22', 302, 4, 18, 743312) Yours truly,
('22', 302, 5, 19, 743325) From a photostate; S.N. 7330

('22', 303, 1, 2, 743706) 156. SPEECH AT OPENING OF NATIONAL COLLEGE, CALCUTTA 1
('22', 303, 2, 3, 743761) February 4, 1921
('22', 303, 3, 4, 743778) FRIENDS, You have just now heard the beautiful prayer 2 sung by the students over there, and I hope that all of you will ponder over the magnificent language of that prayer.
('22', 303, 3, 5, 743952) 3 If we will base all our acts in this institution on prayer, I have very little doubt that we shall come through with added glory to ourselves and to our country.
('22', 303, 3, 6, 744116) I have had the privilege, during these few months, of opening several institutions in several parts of India.
('22', 303, 3, 7, 744226) But I must confess to you that, in opening no other institution have I been so weighed down with anxiety and fear as I am in performing the opening ceremony in connection with this institution.
('22', 303, 3, 8, 744420) As I have elsewhere remarked, all the eyes, all the attention of the student world are centred upon Calcutta.
('22', 303, 3, 9, 744530) You have seen so many telegrams reproduced in the Press, I have seen many more telegrams not reproduced in the Press, congratulating the students on the magnificent response to the country’s call.
('22', 303, 3, 10, 744727) You may have also noticed that as a result of your response the students all over India are withdrawing themselves from Government institutions.
('22', 303, 3, 11, 744872) Great, therefore, is your responsibility and the responsibility of the professors and teachers connected with this institution, of Mr. Das and myself also.
('22', 303, 3, 12, 745028) For myself, I can only assure you that my prayers will attend all your efforts in making this institution a success.
('22', 303, 3, 13, 745145) But I know that no prayer that I can offer, no prayer that our clearer hearts can offer, can be of the slightest service unless the students approach their task in humility and in their fear of God, with perseverance, with single mindedness and with love and a devotion for the country in whose name and for whose sake they have abandoned Government institutions.
('22', 303, 3, 14, 745509) It is not a light task for a student expecting

('22', 310, 2, 24, 761836) 160. WHO IS A “SANATANI” HINDU?
('22', 310, 3, 25, 761868) It has been asked why I call myself an orthodox sanatani Hindu and why I regard myself as a Vaishnava.
('22', 310, 3, 26, 761971) I think I should answer these questions.
('22', 310, 3, 27, 762012) The answer will cover the definition of a sanatani Hindu and include a complete description of a Vaishnava.
('22', 311, 0, 1, 762120) 312 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 311, 1, 2, 762162) According to my belief, a Hindu is anyone who, born in a Hindu family in India, accepts the Vedas, the upanishads and the puranas as holy books; who has faith in the five yamas of truth, non violence, etc., and practises them to the best of his ability; who believes in the existence of the atman 1 and the paramatman 2, and believes, further, that the atman is never born and never dies but, through incarnation in the body, passes from existence to existence and is capable of attaining moksha; who believes that moksha is the supreme end of human striving and believes in varnashrama and cow protection.
('22', 311, 1, 3, 762769) Whoever, besides believing in all these, has been born in a family belonging to the Vaishnava sect and has not forsaken the Vaishnava way; who possesses in some measure the qualities described in Narasinh Mehta’s devotional song entitled “Vaishnavajana” and strives to cultivate these qualities in perfection is a Vaishnava.
('22', 311, 1, 4, 763094) It is my firm belief that I possess in a large measure the characteristics described by me and I have been striving to strengthen them.
('22', 311, 1, 5, 763230) I do not, therefore, hesitate to call myself with all firmness, though humbly, a strict sanatani Hindu and a Vaishnava.
('22', 311, 1, 6, 763350) I believe that the most important outward form of Hinduism is cow protection.
('22', 311, 1, 7, 763428) I regard the Hindu world as important because at present not a single Hindu is capable of giving that protection.
('22', 311, 1, 8, 763542) Among these impotent people, I believe myself to be the least impotent.
('22', 311, 1, 9, 763614) I do not believe that there can be anybody else who has systematically exerted himself as much as I have done, and am still doing, for the protection of cows or who feels for the cow and its progeny as much as I do.
('22', 311, 1, 10, 763830) As long as the Hindus in India show no kindness to the cow, as long as they themselves torture cattle in many ways, as long as they have not succeeded in winning the regard of Muslims and persuading them to stop, out of their regard, the slaughter of cows and as long as they tolerate the killing of cows by the English and salute the British flag, I shall believe that the Brahmins and the Kshatriyas spirit has vanished from Hinduism.
('22', 311, 1, 11, 764267) Therefore, though born a Vaisya, I am ever active in the duties of both.
('22', 311, 1, 12, 764340) I believe that the essence of Hinduism is truth and non violence.
('22', 311, 1, 13, 764406) I have not seen anyone among those whom I know respecting truth so scrupulously as I have been doing right from my childhood.
('22', 311, 1, 14, 764532) The active manifestation of non violence is love—absence of ill will.

('22', 314, 1, 7, 769789) People from Italy, Greece and elsewhere came in and were absorbed by Hinduism, but they were not converted by anyone to Hinduism.
('22', 314, 1, 8, 769919) Merely in course of ages, the numbers have risen and fallen.
('22', 314, 1, 9, 769980) Unlike Christianity or Islam, Hinduism does not invite persons of other faiths to join its fold; it enjoins all to follow their own religions.
('22', 314, 1, 10, 770123) Sister Nivedita 1, for instance, embraced Hinduism but we do not think of her as a Hindu, nor do we boycott or slight her in any way.
('22', 314, 1, 11, 770257) There is no question of anybody embracing Hinduism.
('22', 314, 1, 12, 770309) Everybody can practise Hinduism.
('22', 314, 1, 13, 770342) Varnashrama is a law.
('22', 314, 1, 14, 770364) The practical question is the caste system.
('22', 314, 1, 15, 770408) Castes are subject to increase and decrease [in number].
('22', 314, 1, 16, 770465) They come into existence and they disappear.
('22', 314, 1, 17, 770510) Only the man himself can leave Hinduism, though he may be expelled from the caste.
('22', 314, 1, 18, 770593) Excommu nication by the caste is a mode of punishment and ought to be available to every community.
('22', 314, 1, 19, 770693) It is certainly necessary that the numerous castes should become fewer, and this can be brought about by the councils of the various castes without injury to Hinduism.
('22', 314, 1, 20, 770861) If the various divisions of Vanias merge together and their members marry among themselves, will not harm religion in any way.
('22', 314, 1, 21, 770988) The rules which people observe in regard to food, water and marriage are not essential features of Hinduism but, because self control has been given special importance in Hinduism, restrictions have been laid down, even to the smallest detail in regard to these matters.
('22', 314, 1, 22, 771259) I do not think that they deserve to be condemned, but, at the same time, I would not regard a person who does not observe them as having transgressed dharma.
('22', 314, 1, 23, 771417) Not to have water or food or enter into matrimonial alliance anywhere and everywhere, I regard as civilized behaviour.
('22', 314, 1, 24, 771536) This ensures preservation of health and purity.
('22', 314, 1, 25, 771584) But I believe that not accepting food or water at anybody’s place through contempt is opposed to Hinduism.
('22', 314, 1, 26, 771691) It is my view, based on experience, that the prohibition as to dining with or marrying a person of another varna or another religion is an essential protective fence for its culture put up by Hinduism.
('22', 314, 2, 27, 771893) 1 Margaret E. Nobel, a follower of Vivekananda
('22', 315, 0, 1, 771940) 316 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 315, 1, 2, 771982) Why do I, then, dine even at the homes of Muslims?
('22', 315, 1, 3, 772033) I do so because, even when dining with them, I am able to observe the utmost self restraint.
('22', 315, 1, 4, 772126) Among cooked articles, I go so far as to take bread, because the process of baking bread is absolutely clean and just as pop corn can always be taken, no matter where roasted, similarly bread (not rotli) can be taken wherever it may have been baked.
('22', 315, 1, 5, 772376) But my co workers do not observe even this restriction and eat any articles, otherwise acceptable, in the home of a Muslim or of a person belonging to a caste other than their own, if the articles are prepared hygienically.
('22', 315, 1, 6, 772600) In doing so, they run the risk of being expelled from their caste, but they do not cease to be Hindus.
('22', 315, 1, 7, 772703) The Ashram follows a kind of dharma appropriated to sannyasis.
('22', 315, 1, 8, 772766) There a new caste or a new code of conduct, suitable to the present age and in conformity with Hinduism, is being formed.
('22', 315, 1, 9, 772888) I look upon this effort as an experiment.
('22', 315, 1, 10, 772930) If it succeeds, it will be treated as worthy of adoption.
('22', 315, 1, 11, 772988) If it fails, it will have harmed no one.
('22', 315, 1, 12, 773029) Even those engaged in the experiment will not be harmed, because the basis of the experiment is self control.
('22', 315, 1, 13, 773139) The aim is to be able to carry on the work of service with ease and to see that unlike at present, when religion has come to be confined to rules about eating and drinking, the conventions in those matters are kept in their proper and subordinate place.
('22', 315, 1, 14, 773393) Now remains the issue of untouchability.
('22', 315, 1, 15, 773434) Nobody can trace the origin of this practice.
('22', 315, 1, 16, 773480) I have merely ventured guesses.
('22', 315, 1, 17, 773512) They may be right or wrong.
('22', 315, 1, 18, 773540) But even a blind man can see that the practice of untouchability is contrary to dharma.
('22', 315, 1, 19, 773628) Only, in the same way as the atman’s inhabiting [the body] for ages prevents us from knowing it, the long existence of the practice of untouchability does not permit us to see the adharma inherent in it.
('22', 315, 1, 20, 773832) To make any persons crawl on their stomach, to segregate them, to drive them to live on the outskirts of the village, not to be concerned whether they live or die, to give them food left over by others—all this certainly cannot be religion.
('22', 315, 1, 21, 774073) We are inflicting upon untouchables an outrage grosser than that in the Punjab against which we have been protesting.
('22', 315, 1, 22, 774191) That an untouchable cannot live in our neighbourhood and cannot own land, that an untouchable must, on seeing us, shout: “Please keep at a distance, do not touch me,” and should not be permitted to sit with us in the train—this is not Hinduism.
('22', 315, 1, 23, 774436) This is Dyerism.
('22', 315, 1, 24, 774453) There is no self control in the practice of untouchability.
('22', 315, 1, 25, 774513) An analogy has been cited in justification of it, viz., that a mother, after removing stools, does not touch anything without taking a bath.
('22', 315, 1, 26, 774654) But in this instance the mother
('22', 316, 0, 1, 774686) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 317
('22', 316, 1, 2, 774732) herself does not wish to touch anything and, if we sought to enforce such a rule in respect of Bhangis, nobody will object.
('22', 316, 1, 3, 774856) By treating Bhangis and others as untouchables, we only tolerate filth and breed diseases.
('22', 316, 1, 4, 774947) If we look upon untouchables as touchables, we shall see to it that that limb of ours remains clean.
('22', 316, 1, 5, 775048) I have found the homes of Bhangis far cleaner than many Vaishnava houses.

('22', 316, 3, 11, 775595) 161. SPEECH AT PATNA 1

('22', 316, 5, 13, 775635) Mahatma Gandhi spoke sitting.
('22', 316, 5, 14, 775665) He was ashamed to say that he had forgotten that Maulana Mazharul Haq and he were together in England and that they returned to India by the same boat.
('22', 316, 5, 15, 775817) 2 He remembered the fact when he was reminded of it.
('22', 316, 5, 16, 775870) But he was glad that ever since his return to India from South Africa his friendship with Maulana Haq had gone or increasing and in fact he regarded his house in Patna as his home.
('22', 316, 5, 17, 776051) If it was true, as he had told them, that in the matter of Khilafat he had raised his voice before others, he had but done his duty.
('22', 316, 5, 18, 776184) As he was a staunch Hindu and wanted to live his religion he had realized that he must be friends with Mussulmans, stand by their religion and defend it as if it was his own.
('22', 316, 5, 19, 776359) He wanted to assure them again that he would not rest satisfied till the Khilafat wrong was satisfactorily settled even though he had to give his life in the attempt.
('22', 316, 5, 20, 776526) Maulana Haq had told them that in opening the National College they were laying the foundation of swaraj.
('22', 316, 5, 21, 776632) The college had been already opened by his friend Mr. Haq and he was there to perform but the formal ceremonial.
('22', 316, 5, 22, 776745) When he saw the students that morning praying in solemn earnestness the question came to his mind if they had anything of the kind in any Government college and he thought that the right kind of feeling was coming over them.
('22', 316, 5, 23, 776970) He had to open both the National College and the National University.
('22', 316, 5, 24, 777040) The Vidyapith would be their National University, it would be the machinery which would

('22', 317, 1, 8, 778306) To the professors he wanted to say that they must live up to the ideal of their old rishis, in consonance with their great ancient civilization, and if they did that they might rest assured that the foundation of swaraj had been truly laid in the founding of their institution.
('22', 317, 1, 9, 778584) Referring to students he said that Kalidas had once observed that a guru could give only as much as the neophyte could take.
('22', 317, 1, 10, 778709) Education was a manifestation of the enlightenment they received within and it was the function of the guru to bring out what was within the student, and he hoped that the students in the College would so live and learn at the hands of their teachers that the institution might be an example to the country.
('22', 317, 2, 11, 779017) In the prayer read out to them by Pandey Jagannath Prasadjee he had seen the key of the work they were doing—to get into truth, into light from darkness, into life from a sort of death.
('22', 317, 2, 12, 779203) This was non co operation and the attainment by them of swaraj was the sign of their emerging into the light.
('22', 317, 2, 13, 779313) By co operating with their present hypocritical Government they had become as it were contaminated and had become partners in its crimes.
('22', 317, 2, 14, 779451) They had done so so far because they were equally sinful, but even then they had believed in and feared God.
('22', 317, 2, 15, 779560) And the conviction having at last dawned on them that the Government was wrong and its system vicious, they had come to the decision that they could not co operate with it till it was completely transformed.
('22', 317, 2, 16, 779768) He hated neither the Empire nor those who sustained it; he was out to uproot the system.
('22', 317, 2, 17, 779857) He had hatred for none and entertained for them nothing but sentiments of love.
('22', 317, 2, 18, 779937) But even if his father and his brother had acted in the manner the Government had done he would have felt it his duty to have nothing to do with them.
('22', 317, 2, 19, 780088) If a son lived with a Satanic father he became by that fact partner of his sire’s guilt and no religion sanctioned this partnership even between a father and his son.
('22', 317, 2, 20, 780255) The divine injunction was clear and imperative to cease co operation even with their near and dear ones if they were sinful.
('22', 317, 3, 21, 780380) The first mission of the University therefore would be to teach the ideal of non co operation and to emphasize its basic principle, absolute non violence.

('22', 319, 2, 14, 785668) 162. SPEECH ON NON VIOLENCE, PATNA 2
('22', 319, 3, 15, 785705) February 6, 1921
('22', 319, 4, 16, 785722) Mahatma Gandhi then rose amidst deafening cheers and said that he did not want to detain them longer.

('22', 319, 4, 20, 786013) He would not kill one who considered himself to be his enemy.
('22', 319, 4, 21, 786075) His brother Maulana Mahomed Ali believed in the contrary faith.

('22', 319, 4, 24, 786350) If they did not maintain non violence they were sure to lose their case.
('22', 319, 4, 25, 786423) In them there was no strength left for taking to the sword.

('22', 320, 7, 22, 788596) 164. NOTES
('22', 320, 8, 23, 788607) ABUSING THE KHADDAR
('22', 320, 9, 24, 788627) A friend draws attention to the fact that many who have adopted the khaddar costume are using it as a passport for arrogance, insolence, and, what is worse, fraud.
('22', 320, 9, 25, 788791) He says that they have neither the
('22', 320, 10, 26, 788826) 1 In 1917 during the Champaran Satyagraha 2 This was in reply to the addressee’s telegram which read: “Your decision solicited whether public should boycott local fair or only foreign goods therein.”
('22', 321, 0, 1, 789026) 322 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 321, 1, 2, 789068) spirit of non co operation in them nor the spirit of truth.
('22', 321, 1, 3, 789128) They simply use the khaddar dress as a cloak for their deceit.
('22', 321, 1, 4, 789191) All this is likely, especially during the transition stage, i.e., whilst khaddar is beginning to become fashionable.
('22', 321, 1, 5, 789308) I would only suggest to my correspondent that such abuse of khaddar must not even unconsciously be allowed to be used as an argument against its use.
('22', 321, 1, 6, 789458) Its use today is obligatory on those who believe that there is not sufficient Indian mill made cloth to supply the wants of the nation, that the wants must be supplied in the quickest way possible by increasing home manufacture, and that such manufacture is possible only by making home spinning universal.
('22', 321, 1, 7, 789765) The use of khaddar represents nothing more than a most practical recognition of the greatest economic necessity of the country.
('22', 321, 1, 8, 789893) Even a scoundrel may recognize this necessity, and has, therefore, a perfect right to wear it.
('22', 321, 1, 9, 789988) And if a Government spy wore it to deceive people, I would welcome his use of khaddar as so much economic gain to the country.
('22', 321, 1, 10, 790115) Only I would not give the wearer of the khaddar more than his due.
('22', 321, 1, 11, 790182) And I would therefore not ascribe to him any piety or special virtue.
('22', 321, 1, 12, 790252) It follows, therefore, that co operationists or Government servants may wear khaddar without incurring the danger of being mistaken for non co operationists.
('22', 321, 1, 13, 790410) We may no more shun khaddar than a devout church goer may renounce his church because bad characters go to it for duping gullible people.
('22', 321, 1, 14, 790548) I recall the name of an M. P. who successfully cloaked many of his vices by pretending to be a staunch temperance man.
('22', 321, 1, 15, 790667) Not very long ago a bold and unscrupulous speculator found entry into most respectable circles by becoming a temperance advocate.
('22', 321, 1, 16, 790797) Well has a poet said that “hypocrisy is an ode to virtue.”
('22', 321, 2, 17, 790856) AN APOLOGY
('22', 321, 3, 18, 790867) I must apologize to the reader for the article on the East African Despatch 1 under Mr. Adwani’s name.
('22', 321, 3, 19, 790970) It gives a view which is not borne out by its contents.
('22', 321, 3, 20, 791026) The language is needlessly offensive.
('22', 321, 3, 21, 791064) Whilst I condemn the existing system of Government in severe language, I will not be knowingly guilty of pronouncing unmerited condemnation upon it.
('22', 321, 3, 22, 791213) The Despatch is an honest attempt to do justice to the Indians of East Africa.
('22', 321, 3, 23, 791292) It is true that it has been renderedpossible by the awakening in India.
('22', 321, 3, 24, 791364) But that, too, is a credit to the Government that it is responsive to public opinion when its own
('22', 321, 4, 25, 791462) 1 Of the Government of India to the Home Government vigorously protesting against the policy of racial disability and racial segregation in East Africa
('22', 322, 0, 1, 791614) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 323
('22', 322, 1, 2, 791660) existence is not at stake.
('22', 322, 1, 3, 791687) It is true also that it still betrays a language of patronage.
('22', 322, 1, 4, 791750) But that is only to be expected until Englishmen have begun to regard themselves not as our trustees but as equal partners.
('22', 322, 1, 5, 791874) Whilst I offer this apology to the reader and the Government, I do not wish to be unfair to my assistant.
('22', 322, 1, 6, 791980) Mr. Adwani is a sincere and devoted assistant.
('22', 322, 1, 7, 792027) He endeavours to write calmly and dispassionately.
('22', 322, 1, 8, 792078) But he is young, ambitious and inexperienced.
('22', 322, 1, 9, 792124) Like everyone of us he labours under the handicap of having to write his thoughts in a foreign tongue.
('22', 322, 1, 10, 792227) The mistakes such as his are inevitable.
('22', 322, 1, 11, 792268) I offer the apology because I want to avoid being understood as approving of everything written by my assistant, or other contributors.
('22', 322, 1, 12, 792404) I am anxious to be impartial and fair in conducting Young India.
('22', 322, 2, 13, 792469) Young India, 9 2 1921
('22', 322, 3, 14, 792491) 165. THE GREATEST THING
('22', 322, 4, 15, 792515) It is to be wished that non co operationists will clearly recognize that nothing can stop the onward march of the nation as violence.
('22', 322, 4, 16, 792649) Ireland may gain its freedom by violence.
('22', 322, 4, 17, 792691) Turkey may regain her lost possessions by violence within a measurable distance of time.
('22', 322, 4, 18, 792780) But India cannot win her freedom by violence for a century, because her people are not built in the manner of other nations.
('22', 322, 4, 19, 792905) They have been nurtured in the traditions of suffering.
('22', 322, 4, 20, 792961) Rightly or wrongly, for good or ill, Islam too has evolved along peaceful lines in India.
('22', 322, 4, 21, 793051) And I make bold to say that, if the honour of Islam is to be vindicated through its followers in India, it will only be by methods of peaceful, silent, dignified, conscious, and courageous suffering.
('22', 322, 4, 22, 793251) The more I study that wonderful faith, the more convinced I become that the glory of Islam is due not to the sword but to the sufferings, the renunciation, and the nobility of followers, its early Caliphs.
('22', 322, 4, 23, 793457) Islam decayed when its followers mistaking the evil for the good, dangled the sword in the face of man, and lost sight of the godliness, the humility, and the austerity of its founder and his disciples.
('22', 322, 4, 24, 793660) But I am not, at the present moment, concerned with showing that the basis of Islam, as of all religions, is not violence but suffering, not the taking of life but the giving of it.
('22', 322, 4, 25, 793842) What I am anxious to show is that non co operationists must be true as well to the spirit as to the letter of their vow if they would gain swaraj within one year.
('22', 322, 4, 26, 794005) They may forget non co operation but they
('22', 323, 0, 1, 794047) 324 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 323, 1, 2, 794089) dare not forget non violence.
('22', 323, 1, 3, 794119) Indeed, non co operation is non violence.
('22', 323, 1, 4, 794161) We are violent when we sustain a Government whose creed is violence.
('22', 323, 1, 5, 794230) It bases itself finally not on right but on might.
('22', 323, 1, 6, 794281) Its last appeal is not to reason, nor the heart, but to the sword.
('22', 323, 1, 7, 794348) We are tired of this creed and we have risen against it.
('22', 323, 1, 8, 794405) Let us not ourselves belie our profession by being violent.
('22', 323, 1, 9, 794465) Though the English are few, they are organized for violence.

('22', 323, 1, 11, 794607) Violence for us is a gospel of despair.
('22', 323, 1, 12, 794647) I have seen a pathetic letter from a god fearing Englishwoman who defends Dyerism for she thinks that, if General Dyer had not enacted Jallianwala, women and children would have been murdered by us.
('22', 323, 1, 13, 794846) If we are such brutes as to desire the blood of innocent women and children, we deserve to be blotted out from the face of the earth.

('22', 324, 1, 2, 796614) 166. A MUNICIPAL ENTERPRISE
('22', 324, 2, 3, 796642) The reader will find elsewhere the text 1 of the correspondence between the municipality of Nadiad and the Government of Bombay as represented by the Collector of the District of Kaira in which Nadiad is situated.
('22', 324, 2, 4, 796856) Nadiad is an important town in Gujarat with a population of about 35,000. Its municipality has an elected chairman and contains a majority of elected members.
('22', 324, 2, 5, 797015) Nadiad is noted for its educational activity and has the honour of having produced some of the best educated sons of Gujarat.
('22', 324, 2, 6, 797141) The town has two high schools.
('22', 324, 2, 7, 797172) Its aided high school has been nationalized.
('22', 324, 2, 8, 797217) The municipality runs several primary schools which instruct over five thousand children.
('22', 324, 3, 9, 797307) The question before the citizens was to nationalize all the primary schools.
('22', 324, 3, 10, 797384) The ratepayers, instead of withdrawing the children from these schools, passed a resolution calling upon the municipality to nationalize the primary schools.
('22', 324, 3, 11, 797542) They were in receipt of a yearly grant of Rs. 21,000 and were naturally under the control and supervision of the Education Department.
('22', 324, 3, 12, 797677) The municipality therefore resolved in accordance with the instructions of the electors to nationalize the schools and informed the Government accordingly.
('22', 324, 3, 13, 797833) It will be noticed that the municipality in its proceedings has directly referred to the Congress resolution on non co operation and has adopted this bold policy in furtherance of the attainment of swaraj.
('22', 324, 4, 14, 798039) There was the technical point about the municipality’s statutory obligation to conduct schools under the direct supervision of the Government.
('22', 324, 4, 15, 798182) On this the municipality’s attitude is thus stated:
('22', 324, 5, 16, 798234) It is in complete symapthy with the movement of non co operation designed for the attainment, among other things, of full swaraj and so long as this municipality remains in existence, it will be its bounden duty to help the people of Nadiad in achieving the national purpose .
('22', 324, 5, 17, 798511) So far as the legal difficulty is concerned, it is respectfully suggested that Sec.
('22', 324, 5, 18, 798595) 58, if it runs counter to the express wish of the residents of Nadiad, must automatically remain in abeyance because if the Board correctly understands the temper of the people of Nadiad, they are clearly determined to have nothing to do with Government control over the education of the children, and it need hardly be pointed out that the Board is in full sympathy with the determination of the people.
('22', 324, 6, 19, 799000) 1 Not reproduced here
('22', 325, 0, 1, 799022) 326 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('22', 325, 1, 2, 799064) No one can take exception to the admirable spirit of the people or the correctness of the attitude of the municipality.
('22', 325, 1, 3, 799184) Of course the Government may, if it dare, disband the municipality.
('22', 325, 1, 4, 799252) But any such disbandment must be futile if the ratepayers are determined not to have Government control over the education of their children.
('22', 325, 1, 5, 799394) This is a peaceful revolution on a small scale.
('22', 325, 1, 6, 799442) The success of the movement is due to the cohesion of the people and their ability to manage and finance the education of their children.
('22', 325, 1, 7, 799580) Violence being eschewed, the people of Nadiad are able to give an education in swaraj to their children.
('22', 325, 1, 8, 799685) What is true of the municipality regarding the education of the children is true of the whole of India in every other respect.
('22', 325, 1, 9, 799812) When the people have one mind, ability of management, and recognize the necessity of non violence, if only as a business proposition, swaraj is won.
('22', 325, 1, 10, 799961) Finance is a matter of little consideration.
('22', 325, 1, 11, 800006) For the Government does not bring money from heaven.
('22', 325, 1, 12, 800059) It receives, to paraphrase an expressive Gujarati saying, an anvil weight of metal and returns a needle weight.
('22', 325, 1, 13, 800171) And the pity and the disgrace of it is that even with that niggardly donation, it imprisons and emasculates the tender mind of the nation.
('22', 325, 1, 14, 800310) Were it not for self delusion, we would at least refuse to be party to the ruin of our own children.
('22', 325, 1, 15, 800411) The municipality of Nadiad has shown how easy the whole process of nationalization of education is.
('22', 325, 1, 16, 800511) Lala Daulat Ram’s articles have shown how easy the question of finance is, and how the ordinary fees are almost enough to conduct all our educational institutions.
('22', 325, 1, 17, 800675) I hope that the object lesson given by the municipality of Nadiad will not be lost upon other municipalities similarly situated.

('22', 329, 2, 3, 808894) BLACK MIXING WITH WHITE
('22', 329, 3, 4, 808918) A friend writes 1: Every word of this criticism is justified.
('22', 329, 3, 5, 808980) Whenever a reform is undertaken, there is always a danger of its being abused.
('22', 329, 3, 6, 809059) So it is with khadi.
('22', 329, 3, 7, 809080) I would certainly say that one cannot show perfect patriotism unless one uses khadi, but it cannot be denied, either, that a person wearing khadi can be a C.I.D. 2 man and that another not wearing khadi, either because he is too poor to do so or because he has not come to have faith in khadi, may yet be a patriot.
('22', 329, 3, 8, 809396) Hence, we need not assume that a person wearing khadi is necessarily a patriot.
('22', 329, 3, 9, 809476) We may believe that a person wearing khadi is likely to be a follower of swadeshi.
('22', 329, 3, 10, 809559) It is enough if the aversion to khadi disappears and beauty is seen even in khadi.
('22', 329, 3, 11, 809642) Just as it would not be right to attribute all virtues to khadi, so also we should not be shocked when a person wearing khadi disgraces khadi by his misbehaviour.
('22', 329, 3, 12, 809805) Any kind of outward show must be eschewed, but the outward appearance must be a fit expression of the feelings within.
('22', 329, 3, 13, 809924) Thus, anyone who is simple in mind will also be simple in dress, and he whose heart is devoted to swadeshi will have his dress made of khadi only.
('22', 329, 3, 14, 810071) As long as there are fools and ignoramuses in the world, cheats will flourish.
('22', 329, 3, 15, 810150) We should not, for that reason, allow ourselves to be cheated nor be afraid of cheats.
('22', 329, 3, 16, 810237) We have seen that just as khadi is being exploited, non co operation is also being exploited.
('22', 329, 3, 17, 810331) Many even behave as if they had got a licence to abuse those who co operate [with the Gover nment] merely because they themselves had raised their hands in support of the non co operation resolution.
('22', 329, 3, 18, 810531) Really speaking, exploiting khadi and non co operation pollutes this pure movement and delays the hour of freedom.
('22', 329, 3, 19, 810646) In these wicked times, we find that, when we try to remove impurity from one place, it settles in some other place.
('22', 329, 3, 20, 810762) Despite such difficulties, this is the only way left for anyone who has come to see the truth.

('22', 330, 1, 2, 811140) ABOUT “ANTYAJAS”
('22', 330, 2, 3, 811157) I have received many letters of advice on this subject.
('22', 330, 2, 4, 811213) All of them cannot be published.
('22', 330, 2, 5, 811246) They contain more of censure than of argument.
('22', 330, 2, 6, 811293) Quite a few letters express ideas in agreement with mine.
('22', 330, 2, 7, 811351) They certainly need not be published.
('22', 330, 2, 8, 811389) It remains to convince those who argue on the opposite side.
('22', 330, 2, 9, 811450) A young man writes to say that I have made an unfailing weapon like non co operation less effective by raising the question of the untouchables.
('22', 330, 2, 10, 811595) He says that even if untouchables are not really such, this is not the proper time to raise this issue, that as a result of this one of the schools has chosen to go back to the Government; he adds, further, that in the end all the sanatani Hindus will go over to the side of the Government and take their revenge either on me or on non co operation.
('22', 330, 2, 11, 811945) I have no such fear.
('22', 330, 2, 12, 811966) The number of those who would cut off the nose to spite the face is never very large at any place.
('22', 330, 2, 13, 812065) I believe that there are not many such in India.
('22', 330, 2, 14, 812114) Among those who today oppose this movement are some who sincerely believe that Hinduism will perish if the untouchables are no more treated as untouchables.
('22', 330, 2, 15, 812271) Gradually, they will realize that Hinduism has fallen on evil days because of its sanctioning the practice of untouchability.

('22', 345, 12, 26, 847749) The Servant of India has referred me to the remarks of a Poona non co operator to illustrate that all non co operators are actuated not by love but by hate.
('22', 345, 12, 27, 847906) I have never doubted it.

('22', 346, 0, 1, 847955) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 347
('22', 346, 1, 2, 848001) admitted that many non co operators are impelled by hate, that most are impelled by a sense of justice, and some few by love only.
('22', 346, 1, 3, 848132) The recital of the Poona facts is followed by a rebuke.
('22', 346, 1, 4, 848188) Thus the writer ends:
('22', 346, 2, 5, 848210) To enrol under the banner of love and peace the forces of hatred and violence, to believe that a simple doctrine can convert every heart into the purest gold, to persist in smoking a peaceful pipe on a stack of hay and in apparent innocence to disclaim all responsibility for the consequences, is amazing conduct even in a prophet.
('22', 346, 2, 6, 848542) The rebuke, I am sorry to say, is based on three unwarranted assumptions.
('22', 346, 2, 7, 848616) I have not enrolled under the banner of love and peace the forces of hatred and violence, but I have enrolled under the banner of justice all those who wish to secure it; and in doing so, as a practical reformer, I have not hesitated to take in those who I know are actuated by hatred.
('22', 346, 2, 8, 848902) Even the latter are entitled to justice.
('22', 346, 2, 9, 848943) Only I must see that they do not give play to their hatred.
('22', 346, 2, 10, 849003) I claim that the vast majority of the haters are honourably fulfilling the compact, because they realize that non violence is the best and the only policy for the country if it is to attain justice, and not merely to vent anger.
('22', 346, 2, 11, 849232) I therefore do not need to believe that ‘a simple doctrine can convert every heart into the purest gold’.
('22', 346, 2, 12, 849338) But I do believe that practicalexperience is likely to change policy into creed.
('22', 346, 2, 13, 849419) For I believe that people are by nature loving and peaceful.
('22', 346, 2, 14, 849480) When they hate and kill, they do so against their better nature.
('22', 346, 2, 15, 849545) I am not ‘smoking a peaceful pipe on a stack of hay and in apparent innocence disclaiming all responsibility for the consequences’.
('22', 346, 2, 16, 849677) On the contrary, as an expert miner, I am moving in a coal mine full of explosive gases with a safety lamp well protected against explosion, with a due sense of responsibility, and with the full knowledge that, in spite of the apparent safety of the lamp, the gases may, by some mysterious processes, any moment explode.
('22', 346, 2, 17, 849998) If they do, I shall not shirk responsibility.

('22', 347, 3, 4, 850779) 179. HAND SPINNING AGAIN
('22', 347, 4, 5, 850804) The Servant of India a fling too at spinning and that is based as I shall presently show on ignorance of the facts.
('22', 347, 4, 6, 850920) Spinning does protect a woman’s virtue, because it enables women, who are today working on public roads and are often in danger of having their modesty outraged, to protect themselves, and I know no other occupation that lacs of women can follow save spinning.
('22', 347, 4, 7, 851181) Let me inform the jesting writer that several women have already returned to the sanctity of their homes and taken to spinning which they say is the one occupation which means so much barkat (blessing).
('22', 347, 4, 8, 851384) I claim for it the properties of a musical instrument, for whilst a hungry and a naked woman will refuse to dance to the accompaniment of a piano, I have seen women beaming with joy to see the spinning wheel work, for they know that they can through that rustic instrument both feed and clothe themselves.
('22', 347, 4, 9, 851690) Yes, it does solve the problem of India’s chronic poverty and is an insurance against famine.

('22', 350, 3, 7, 858421) 181. SOCIAL BOYCOTT
('22', 350, 4, 8, 858441) Non co operation being a movement of purification is bringing to the surface all our weaknesses as also excesses of even our strong points.
('22', 350, 4, 9, 858581) Social boycott is an age old institution.
('22', 350, 4, 10, 858623) It is coeval with caste.
('22', 350, 4, 11, 858648) It is the one terrible sanction exercised with great effect.
('22', 350, 4, 12, 858709) It is based upon the notion that a community is not bound to extend its hospitality or service to an excommunicate.
('22', 350, 4, 13, 858825) It answered when every village was a self contained unit, and the occasions of recalcitrancy were rare.
('22', 350, 4, 14, 858929) But when opinion is divided, as it is today, on the merits of non co operation, when its new application is having a trial, a summary use of social boycott in order to bend a minority to the will of the majority is a species of unpardonable violence.
('22', 350, 4, 15, 859180) If persisted in, such boycott is bound to destroy the movement.
('22', 350, 4, 16, 859244) Social boycott is applicable and effective when it is not felt as a punishment and accepted by the object of boycott as a measure of discipline.
('22', 350, 4, 17, 859389) Moreover, social boycott to be admissible in a campaign of non violence must never savour of inhumanity.
('22', 350, 4, 18, 859494) It must be civilized.
('22', 350, 4, 19, 859516) It must cause pain to the party using it, if it causes inconvenience to its object.
('22', 350, 4, 20, 859600) Thus, depriving a man of the services of a medical man, as is reported to have been done in Jhansi, is an act of inhumanity tantamount in the moral code to an attempt to murder.
('22', 350, 4, 21, 859778) I see no difference in murdering a man and withdrawing medical aid from a man who is on the point of dying.
('22', 350, 4, 22, 859886) Even the laws of war, I apprehend, require the giving of medical relief to the enemy in need of it.
('22', 350, 4, 23, 859986) To deprive a man of the use of an only village well is notice to him to quit that village.

('22', 359, 3, 4, 880580) DEAR MR. CORBETT, I thank you for your letter which I received in Lahore on Thursday 1. Though we seem to be drifting I am sure that we are drifting only to come nearer.
('22', 359, 3, 5, 880750) The false and unnatural relations that subsist today are really keeping us apart.
('22', 359, 3, 6, 880832) I am not against free and voluntary emigration but I am indifferent about it and even opposed to any stimulation.
('22', 359, 3, 7, 880946) I thoroughly distrust the Fiji authorities.
('22', 359, 3, 8, 880990) I have heard enough to convince me of the truth in the main of the emigrants’ version.
('22', 359, 3, 9, 881077) In these circumstances I should deplore the departure of a single emigrant to Fiji.
('22', 359, 3, 10, 881161) Emigration would be a proper enterprise when India has gained full control of her own affairs and can treat with the dominions on an equal footing.
('22', 359, 3, 11, 881309) But if anybody goes to Fiji to conduct an inquiry whilst India is in aferment and her status undermined, I know that you are one who will not do conscious injustice to her.
('22', 359, 3, 12, 881482) I am quite at one with you on the question of the Hindu treatment of the untouchables.
('22', 359, 3, 13, 881569) There is absolutely no excuse to offer for the evil.
('22', 359, 3, 14, 881622) And I am hoping that with the untouchability of India in the Empire will go the untouchability in Hinduism.
('22', 359, 3, 15, 881730) I do look upon our present status as a deserved nemesis for our treatment of the so called pariah.
('22', 359, 4, 16, 881829) Yours sincerely,

('22', 364, 5, 10, 890971) 191. NOTES
('22', 364, 6, 11, 890982) HOW MANY LAWYERS AND STUDENTS HELP?
('22', 364, 7, 12, 891018) Everywhere I have been asked whether lawyers and students who do not carry out the Congress resolution affecting them can help the movement in any other way.
('22', 364, 7, 13, 891176) The question is rather strange for it assumes that if a lawyer or a student cannot non co operate as such he cannot help at all.
('22', 364, 7, 14, 891305) There are undoubtedly hundreds of students and scores of lawyers who are not suspending their normal studies or their practice, as the case may be, only out of weakness.
('22', 364, 7, 15, 891475) A lawyer who cannot suspend practice can certainly help with money, he can give his spare hours to public service, he can introduce honesty and fair dealings in his profession, he can cease to consider clients as fit prey for his pecuniary ambition, he can cease to have anything to do with touts, he can promote settlement of cases by private arbitration, he can at least do spinning himself for one or two hours per day, he can simplify the life of his family, he can induce the members of the family to do spinning religiously for a certain time daily, he can adopt for himself and his family the use of khaddar.
('22', 364, 7, 16, 892091) These are only some of the things that can be done by every lawyer.
('22', 364, 7, 17, 892159) Because a man cannot or will not carry out a particular part of the non co operation programme, he need not be shy about the other items.
('22', 364, 7, 18, 892297) One thing a practising lawyer may not do: he may no longer figure as a leader on public platforms.
('22', 364, 7, 19, 892396) He must be content to be a silent worker What I have said about practising lawyers applies to students also who cannot or will not withdaw from schools.
('22', 364, 7, 20, 892549) Most of our volunteers are drawn from the student world.
('22', 364, 7, 21, 892606) Volunteering is a privilege and a student who has not been able to withdraw from Government schools

('22', 365, 1, 6, 893005) And we must do nothing that would restore their prestige till they are nationalized and answer the requirements of the nation.
('22', 365, 2, 7, 893132) ROWDYISM
('22', 365, 3, 8, 893141) Certainly, no co operation has received a rude shock by disgraceful behaviour at the Bombay and Poona meetings towards Messrs Shastri and Paranjapye.

('22', 366, 3, 8, 895781) 192. THE CONDITIONS OF SWARAJ
('22', 366, 4, 9, 895811) Swaraj is easy of attainment before October next if certain simple conditions can be fulfilled.
('22', 366, 4, 10, 895907) I ventured to mention one year in September last because I knew that the conditions were incredibly simple and I felt that the atmosphere in the country was responsive.
('22', 366, 4, 11, 896076) The past five months’ experience has confirmed me in the opinion.
('22', 366, 4, 12, 896142) I am convinced that the country has never been so ready for establishing swaraj as now.
('22', 366, 4, 13, 896230) But it is necessary for us as accurately as possible to know the conditions.
('22', 366, 4, 14, 896307) One supreme indispensable condition is the continuance of non violence.
('22', 366, 4, 15, 896379) The rowdyism, hooliganism, looting that we have recently witnessed are disturbing elements.
('22', 366, 4, 16, 896471) They are danger signals.
('22', 366, 4, 17, 896496) We must be able to arrest their progress.
('22', 366, 4, 18, 896538) The spirit of democracy cannot be established in a year in the midst of terrorism whether Governmental or popular.
('22', 366, 4, 19, 896653) In some respects popular terrorism is more antagonistic to the growth of the democratic spirit than the Governmental.
('22', 366, 4, 20, 896771) For the latter strengthens the spirit of democracy, whereas the former kills it.
('22', 366, 4, 21, 896852) Dyerism has evoked a yearning after freedom as nothing else has.
('22', 366, 4, 22, 896917) But internal Dyerism, representing as it will, terrorisrn by a majority, will establish an oligarchy such as will stifle the spirit of all free discussion and conduct.
('22', 366, 4, 23, 897085) Non violence, therefore, as against the government and as between ourselves is absolutely essential to speedy success.
('22', 366, 4, 24, 897204) And we must be able to devise means of observing it on our part in spite of the gravest provocations.
('22', 366, 4, 25, 897306) The next condition is our ability to bring into being the Congress organization in terms of the new constitution 1, whichaims at
('22', 366, 5, 26, 897435) 1 Vide “Congress constitution adopted at Nagpur session”, december 1920.
('22', 367, 0, 1, 897508) 368 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GADNDHI
('22', 367, 1, 2, 897551) establishing a Congress agency in every village with a proper electorate.
('22', 367, 1, 3, 897625) It means both money and ability to give effect to Congress policies.
('22', 367, 1, 4, 897694) What is really needed is not a large measure of sacrifice but ability to organize and to take simple, concerted action.
('22', 367, 1, 5, 897814) At the present moment we have not even succeeded in carrying the Congress message to every home in the 7 1/2 lakhs of villages of India.
('22', 367, 1, 6, 897951) To do this work means at least 250 honest workers for as many districts, who have influence in their respective districts and who believe in the Congress programme.
('22', 367, 1, 7, 898116) No village, no circle need wait for instructions from headquarters for founding their respective organizations.
('22', 367, 1, 8, 898228) There are certain things that are applicable to all.
('22', 367, 1, 9, 898281) The most potent thing is swadeshi.
('22', 367, 1, 10, 898316) Every home must have the spinning wheel and every village can organized itself in less than a month and become self supporting for its cloth.
('22', 367, 1, 11, 898458) Just imagine what this silent revolution means and there would be no difficulty in sharing my belief that swadeshi means swaraj and swadharma 1. Every man and woman can give some money—be it even a pice—to the Tilak Swarj Fund.
('22', 367, 1, 12, 898686) And we need have no anxiety about financing the movement.
('22', 367, 1, 13, 898744) Every man and woman can deny himself or herself all luxury, all ornamentation, all intoxicants at least for one year.
('22', 367, 1, 14, 898862) And we shall have not only money but we shall have boycotted many foreign articles.
('22', 367, 1, 15, 898946) Our civilization, our culture, our swaraj depend not upon multiplying our wants—self indulgence—but upon restricting our wants—self denial.
('22', 367, 1, 16, 899086) We can do nothing without Hindu Muslim unity and without killing the snake of untouchability.
('22', 367, 1, 17, 899180) Untouchability is a corroding poison that is eating into the vitals of Hindu society.
('22', 367, 1, 18, 899266) Varnashram is not a religion of superiority and inferiority.
('22', 367, 1, 19, 899327) No man of God can consider another man as inferior to himself.
('22', 367, 1, 20, 899390) He must consider every man as his blood brother.
('22', 367, 1, 21, 899439) It is the cardinal principle of every religion.
('22', 367, 1, 22, 899487) If this is a religious battle, no argument is necessary to convince the reader that self denial must be its supreme test.
('22', 367, 1, 23, 899609) Khilafat cannot be saved, the Punjab inhumanity 2 cannot be redressed, without godliness.
('22', 367, 1, 24, 899699) Godliness means change of heart—in political language, changing the angle of vision.
('22', 367, 1, 25, 899784) And such a change can come in a moment.
('22', 367, 1, 26, 899824) My belief is that India is ripe for that change.
('22', 367, 2, 27, 899873) 1 One’s own duty 2 The original has "humanity".
('22', 368, 0, 1, 899921) VOL. 22 : 23 NOVEMBER, 1920 5 APRIL, 1921 369
('22', 368, 1, 2, 899967) Let us then rivet our attention on: 1. Cultivating the spirit of non violence.
('22', 368, 1, 3, 900046) 2. Setting up Congress organizations in every village.
('22', 368, 1, 4, 900101) 3. Introducing the spinning wheel in every home and manufacturing all the cloth required for our wants through the village weaver.
('22', 368, 1, 5, 900232) 4. Collecting as much money as possible.

('22', 371, 1, 3, 906131) This anonymous correspondent writes:
('22', 371, 2, 4, 906168) The atrocities perpetrated in the Punjab by the autocratic officials of the British Government have moved me very strongly and, for the past four months, I have been thinking of giving up my job.

('22', 372, 1, 2, 908706) 197. RAWALPINDI SISTERS
('22', 372, 2, 3, 908730) I have been receiving the blessings of sisters from Bengal and other regions for the cause of swaraj.
('22', 372, 2, 4, 908832) I have seen young girls handing over all their ornaments.
('22', 372, 2, 5, 908890) Those who were moving in very fine muslins in the past, are seen wearing khadi saris.

('22', 372, 2, 8, 909142) Its residents are wealthy people.
('22', 372, 2, 9, 909176) The sentiments which I observed among the women of Rawalpindi were, however, beyond my imagination.
('22', 372, 2, 10, 909276) The women’s rally was held at eleven in the morning.
('22', 372, 2, 11, 909329) 1 Its venue was an open ground in a garden.

('22', 372, 2, 13, 909454) The sisters were seated around a dais.

('22', 372, 2, 15, 909583) Quite a large number joined in the chorus.

('22', 375, 2, 10, 915635) The Council has accepted a resolution recording its regret over what happened during the fateful April of 1919, 3 and, as if to mock us, almost at the time that these empty sentiments were being uttered, the magistrates in various provinces were hatching plots of repression.
('22', 375, 2, 11, 915911) It was a most telling illustration of what is meant by wordy repentance.
('22', 375, 2, 12, 915984) India today wants no magnanimous speech nor, for that matter, any magnanimous action.

('22', 380, 4, 7, 927157) 202. SPEECH AT NANKANA SAHEB
('22', 380, 5, 8, 927186) March 3, 1921
('22', 380, 6, 9, 927200) The following is the substance of Mr. Gandhi’s Hindustani speech delivered at Nankana Saheb Gurudwara when he visited it together with Maulana Shaukat Ali: I have come as a pilgrim to tender you my sympathy.
('22', 380, 6, 10, 927408) I received a wire 1 of the tragedy 2 from a Sikh friend at Ghurkha.
('22', 380, 6, 11, 927476) I showed it toLala Lajpatrai and friends.
('22', 380, 6, 12, 927518) The news was so staggering that they would not believe it without confirmation.
('22', 380, 6, 13, 927598) We hastened back to Lahore to find that the news was all terribly true.
('22', 380, 6, 14, 927670) I cancelled my visit to Multan and awaited further information.
('22', 380, 6, 15, 927734) The next day I proceeded to Lyallpur and thence to the Sikh Divan 3 at Shri.
('22', 380, 6, 16, 927811) I heard there that the cremation 4 was taking place that day.
('22', 380, 6, 17, 927873) It was too late to attend when the news was received.
('22', 380, 6, 18, 927927) I could not make this pilgrimage earlier as I was bound to keep important appointments at Amritsar and Lucknow.
('22', 380, 6, 19, 928039) Meantime I have heard much about the immolation.
('22', 380, 6, 20, 928088) I need hardly give you my assurance that your grief is mine.
('22', 380, 6, 21, 928149) I am so constituted that the sufferings of others make me miserable.
('22', 380, 6, 22, 928218) And were it not for the futility of suicide to end grief, I should long ere this have done away with my life by suicide.
('22', 380, 6, 23, 928339) And so when I heard of the tragedy of Nankana I felt like wanting to be among the victims.
('22', 380, 6, 24, 928430) As it is I can but show my sympathy to those that are left behind.
('22', 380, 6, 25, 928497) I must confess that I have not yet been able to come to any final judgment as to what actually happened.
('22', 380, 6, 26, 928602) It seems almost unbelievable that not a man died at the hands of the Akali 5 party.
('22', 380, 6, 27, 928686) Did not the brave men who were armed with kirpans 6 and battle axes retaliate even in
('22', 380, 7, 28, 928772) 1 On February 20, when Gandhiji was at Rawalpindi 2 Vide footnote 2, “Letter to C.F Andrews.

('22', 382, 1, 9, 931855) And it is quite capable of dividing you from the rest of India.
('22', 382, 1, 10, 931919) I ask you to resist any such temptation with all your might and to unite with the rest of India to end this Satanic system of Government.
('22', 382, 1, 11, 932057) A friend has just now said that the Sikhs have passed their examination in suffering.
('22', 382, 1, 12, 932143) I join issue with him and suggest to you that your examination has only just commenced.
('22', 382, 1, 13, 932231) How are you going to use this newly acquired strength?
('22', 382, 1, 14, 932286) The same friend drew my attention to the fact that your kirpans and your battle axes were part of your dress.
('22', 382, 1, 15, 932396) So let them be.
('22', 382, 1, 16, 932412) But I assure you that the time has not come for their use, if it is ever to come.
('22', 382, 1, 17, 932494) All the national associations have recognized the present necessity of non violence.
('22', 382, 1, 18, 932579) Your kirpans must therefore remain scrupulously sheathed and the hatchets buried.
('22', 382, 1, 19, 932661) If you and I will prove worthy of the martyrs, we will learn the lesson of humility and suffering from them; and you will dedicate all your matchless bravery to the service of the country and her redemption.
